tags: they all seem like really sweet people
I'm glad David and Matt got along so well
it makes me happy to know that they're good people
summary:
Behind the Scenes of Day of the Doctor (Part 11)

  Excerpt from this BBC interview with Matt Smith: ‘The Day Of The Doctor’...
caption:
Behind the Scenes of Day of the Doctor (Part 11)

Excerpt from this BBC interview with Matt Smith:

‘The Day Of The Doctor’ marks the return of David Tennant and Billie Piper, and we get the revelation of John Hurt’s Doctor. What was it like working alongside them all?

It was a joy to work with David, Billie and John Hurt. I’ve worked with Billie before and I’d obviously seen all of David’s work, especially as the Doctor. He’s a brilliant actor and a brilliant Doctor. It’s quite strange, I always sort of get that surreal thing of looking at David and thinking, ‘Oh my God, there’s Doctor Who’. And John is acting royalty. Another wonderful Doctor and again, a good bloke. I think looking back over my tenure on this show, one of the great privileges has been the quality of actors that you get to work with.

Was there any kind of competitiveness between the different Doctors and companions?

No, we’re not competitive, I mean there’s a funny bit in the script between the 10th and 11th Doctors comparing Sonics, so there’s competitiveness in the story, but not off screen. We just had a laugh and it was exciting to see David back in the pin striped suit and Converse. John only has to move his eyes and he flaws you and Billie is Billie. I adore Billie, so we had a great time.

Were there any moments when you were standing on the floor waiting for action to be called and thinking ‘Oh my goodness, I’m actually doing this’?

Of course, there’s always those moments in Doctor Who when you’re going, ‘Wow we’re doing Doctor Who and there’s David Tennant over there and John Hurt over there and Billie over there and there’s a Redgrave over there’. There are a lot of those moments when you make this show. 

But I think the wonderful thing was there was great down time. I just enjoyed spending time with David and obviously for me as well, as I am about to leave the show, it was really interesting to talk to him about that experience and his experience on the show, because it is a very individual experience playing the Doctor. It was quite nice to go, ‘What was that bit like for you?’ and it was just sort of enlightening really.

Other parts of this photoset: [one] [two] [three] [four] [five] [six] [seven] [eight] [nine] [ten]
[ Full list of behind-the-scenes photo sets ]

summary: (Actual conversation with my mother) Me: *Shows her doodle of Ten* Her: Why don’t you draw him as Hardy? Me: You mean DI...
caption:
(Actual conversation with my mother)

Me: *Shows her doodle of Ten*
Her: Why don’t you draw him as Hardy?
Me: You mean DI Grumpycat?
Her: No, Shitface!

Ah… it’s nice having someone as geeky as me around.

As a sidenote: the most distracting thing to me while watching Broadchurch now isn’t the amount of actors who have also been in Doctor Who, it’s his STUPID TIE!  Seriously I’ve never wanted to just reach in the TV screen and fix someones tie before.  It’s ALWAYS crooked!

summary: i need to drink more water David Tennant as Walter Jodell in Camping S01E01[[MORE]] literally i’ve found more ways to solve this...
caption:
i need to drink more water

David Tennant as Walter Jodell in Camping S01E01

literally i’ve found more ways to solve this than she did and most them still involved me still refining the planner while keeping a flashlight on my head and not having to do anything super physical. like give a snuggle back or petting his head or give him a club cracker idk. use the flashlight as source of heat? tickle him until he begs for freedom’s fresh wildlife air.

blog.name: grammaroffandom
blog.title: Fandom Nerd
blog.description:
Skyler/Sky • he/him

trans-masculine/non-binary

Doctor Who | Supernatural | Harry Potter

Also gay stuff

body:
If you’re a fan of Doctor Who and Harry Potter, PLEASE READ THIS! I promise you won’t regret it! Some of the information in here is unbelievable. For example, Dudley Dursley is played by Patrick Troughton’s grandson. I can’t say I was expecting that. Filch is played by David Bradley (First Doctor [in modern episodes]) and Ollivander is played by John Hurt (War Doctor)! Will J.K. Rowling release another three Harry Potter books, because apparently Eight had the complete set of TEN books in his TARDIS! Plus, Rory may secretly be a wizard, because Mr. Weasley and and Rory’s dad are played by the same person. Personally, I think Rory used magic to come back from the dead.

http://tardis.wikia.com/wiki/Harry_Potter

Harry Potter
